item.title: To amend the Small Business Act to provide for grants to small business development centers, and for other purposes.

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Small Business.

Main Street Stabilization Act of 2013 - Directs the Small Business Administration (SBA) to establish a grant program for small business development centers.

Requires program funding to be used for: (1) the development of business advisory capacity, (2) the development of online tools and resources for struggling small businesses, (3) the deployment of additional resources to help industry sectors with a high presence of small businesses, and (4) the development of a listing of financing options for small business capital access.

Prohibits the SBA from awarding an entity under this Act more than $250,000 in grant funds.
item.name: Introduced in House

bill.title: Main Street Stabilization Act of 2013

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Small Business.

bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: By Mr. BRALEY of Iowa:H.R. 1283.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:This bill is enacted pursuant to the power granted toCongress and Article I, Section 8, Clause 18 of the UnitedStates Constitution.[Page H1719]

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
